I think K.O., like a lot of people on both sides of politics, was more comfortable as the outsider, Cheering for a party that was out of power, taking on the party that was in power. Before he left MSNBC he was getting too vitriolic, and too angry, and was beginning to fulminate just a bit too much, descending into name-calling, and living for personal feuds.
I think this is a guy that needs an enemy, and his employers both at MSNBC and the new network that hardly anyone watches became that enemy. An eternal sense of injustice can make someone a powerful advocate, but it can also eat someone alive.Â
Sorry, Keith, but I think you've Burnt yourself out. Good luck.
